values:
There's a whole n'other conversation going on.

In a parallel universe.

Where nothing breaks and nothing hurts.

There's a waltz playing frozen in time.

Blades of grass on tiny bare feet.

I look at you and you're looking at me.



Could you beam me up?

Give me a minute,I don't know what I'd say in it.

I'd probably just stare,

Happy just to be there holding your face.

Beam me up.

Let me be lighter, tired of being a fighter.

I think, a minutes enough.

Just beam me up.



Some black birds soaring in the sky.

Barely a breath I caught one last sight.

Tell me that was you, saying goodbye.

There are times I feel the shiver and cold.

It only happens when I'm on my own.

That's how you tell me I'm not alone.



Could you beam me up?

Give me a minute,I don't know what I'd say in it.

I'd probably just stare,

Happy just to be there holding your face.

Beam me up.

Let me be lighter, tired of being a fighter.

I think, a minutes enough.

Just beam me up.



In my head, I see your baby blues.

I hear your voice and I,

I break in two and now there's one of me with you.



So when I need you can I send you a sign?

I'll burn a candle and turn off the lights.

I'll pick a star and watch you shine.



Could you beam me up?

Give me a minute,

I don't know what I'd say in it.

I'd probably just stare,

Happy just to be there holding your face.

Beam me up.

Let me be lighter, tired of being a fighter.

I think, a minutes enough.

Just beam me up.

Beam me up.

Beam me up.

Could you beam me up?
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/69143.html

If I could take away the pain and put a smile on your face, baby I would.

Then do it JB, cause I'm strugglin'
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/69064.html

There has been far too many suicides lately. From hockey players to 15 year old boys. It's just not right. And I know there's probably many others that don't make the news. My brother's best friend killed himself when he was 18 and to this day it is still so heart-breaking.

I know this probably won't be seen by a lot of people, but I'm going to make it public anyway. As someone who knows what it's like to be different, and to be bullied relentlessly I too felt like it would never get better. But it did, and when it did I ran with it and never looked back. The people who mocked me soon wanted to date me and be a part of my life and I had the pleasure of being the bigger person.

So please, you will be the bigger and better person then those who bring you down. I know that depression is a disease that I hope to and probably will never understand, but know that I would feel honoured to know you and your life is worth it. The uniqueness you bring to the world is worth living for and I hope you can see it through regardless of the situation.
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/68195.html

So I should be studying for my French exam right now, but I'm here updating instead. Why? Because I studied for 5 hours yesterday and feel no further ahead. Sigh.. I'm kind of done with academia let me tell you. I mean, once I graduate I will have a Bachelors and an Advanced Diploma, but it's just getting SO tiring. Like I barely have the drive to care anymore..

Now it's time for something I haven't done in awhile, a sports rant.

I get that the Jays acquired a lot of talent over the past few weeks, and I get that they want to give them a chance to flex their muscles, but what I don't understand is why Travis Snider has to suffer??? I'm not just saying this because of his dashing good looks and awesome mustache, and sending him back to Triple A a month ago was completely legit.  But even after proving himself, getting three hits and stealing a base in one game alone, you send him down AGAIN??? I don't get it. I really don't. It's got to be horrible for his self confidence, you're showing him that even when he has vast improvement he's still the first one to go down. Why not Hill or Lind? Who I've seen have much worse at bats than Snider in the last few games. Frustrating.

Anyway, I should probably study now. Hope Y'all have a great weekend! NKOTBSB BABY!
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/67493.html

Ever since I saw NKOTBSB in concert a few weeks ago I've been on a major BSB kick. Not that I don't always enjoy them, but lately I've been really rockin out.

In other news Andrew moved in with me a week ago, and well, it's wonderful. I'm so happy we were able to get past all the bull in our relationship and grow up and hopefully we spend the rest of our lives together in love.

How weird is it to see Winnipeg on the Leafs sked for next season??? LOVE IT!! Anyways I should head to bed as I'm going to Marineland tomorrow for the company picnic...wooo!
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/66724.html

I'm so happy because today I found my friends, they're in my head.

Seriously missing Mr. Cobain right now!
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/66422.html

So last night I had my MRI..
I was pretty whatever about it as I've had some pretty crazy tests in my life and I figured this would be a piece of cake
I was fine until the person before me couldn't have his MRI because they weren't able to sedate him enough so he would be completely out cold. Then I got to thinking well why would he want to be asleep...it's just an MRI..
Then I found out..
I wasn't THAT freaked out as the technician was super nice and gave me John Mayer to listen too...it's just that the machine was so loud and the noises would change with each picture being taken...just very unsettling..now to see if there's anything wrong with my brain.

On another note....

WHAT THE FUCK is with players hitting my Stajy? Like seriously...he's the most non-threatening person and yet he seems to have a target on his back this season.

It saddens me to have to disown one of the Stall boys, but it must be done, what a disgusting hit...
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/65411.html

Every time I hear this song..
I think of you and everything that could've been.

I know that's stupid. And we've both chosen are respective, separate, paths, but there's always that lingering feeling.

I know where you hide, alone in your car
Know all of things that make you who you are
I know that goodbye means nothing at all
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/64201.html

I hate it when it feels like something big in my life is coming to an end
And the events that make me the most sad? Sports.

When Alyn McCauley got traded in that RIDICULOUS Owen Nolan trade TWO weeks after I bought my Jersey. He was the first Leaf I ever met and was the nicest guy about it.

:(...When my darling Matthew was traded. It was inevitable yes, but I still remember that heart breaking press conference, and it's just horrible. It still makes me incredibly sad

And now, Cito has left us. I can still vividly remember wearing Robbie Alamar's World Series at the age of 5. Most amazing thing ever.

The only saving grace?

Travis Snider's psudo Cito-Stache <3<3<3

I'm pathetic.
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/63893.html

My new pet peeve:

When people comment on an artist's picture or tour date talking TO the artist.

Example:

"I really hope i will be able to come to see you, let me tell you, i feel  kinda silly spending so much money on a concert though.... if it ends  up that i do go then it will be the second time i see u live in concert  but i still think you should come back to Phoenix one more time...   xoxo"

Eminem does not read this. And IF he does he doesn't need your life story.

Argh. Maybe I'm being stupid, but it just really annoys me...
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/63725.html

...I'm so lost without you.

This is going to be the most cliched and random post ever. You have been warned.
So I saw my Aunt from Vancouver yesterday and she gave me a whole bunch of pictures of relatives and me when I was younger.
I miss the days when things were simpler, and I didn't have to fight every day to maintain relationships with people I could careless about just prevent them from ruining my life.
I miss Uncle Joe the most. I never truly realized how much of a pillar of strength and glue he was for me and the McBride clan.
I hope he's at least somewhat proud of me...I'm trying...

On a completely random note..
STACEY READ THIS!!!!!!!!

MATT STAJAN GOT MARRIED AT THE LIBERTY GRAND ON SATURDAY!!!!
WHY DO I KNOW THIS?
MY MOM'S BEST FRIEND WAS THERE!!!
AHHHHHHHHHH!
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/63268.html

I love when one of my favourite artits come out with a new song and it just makes me feel so awesome inside.
Sometimes I forget how much music effects my life.
Even if you're not a fam you should give Not Afraid-Eminem a listen. Its epic.

What do you think the chances of Eminem opening for BSB are?
...yeah about -400% I know:( A girl can dream....


I'm not afraid...
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/63177.html

Life is good.

Work is busy.

But I would just like to announce that the Adam Carolla Show is back. My life is complete again.<3

Y'all should download this shit. He's hilarious. Go to iTunes >> Podcasts >> Adam Carolla

Oh god I'm such an XML sucker already..
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/62949.html

....you labeled me, I labeled you, so I dub thee UNFORGIVEN

Fuck.
You.
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/62688.html

Why is it that every time I get some incredible news something equally as terrible has to happen? I diodn't even get to be happy about getting a job for more than 2 days and now this. Andrew no longer has any feelings for me. And yes, he's said that before and we've flip flopped, but this time it just feels different..more real and I didn't think anything could hurt more than the first time he broke up with me, but it does. Four years of love and dedication and faith that everything would be okay to come to this.

Maybe it's for the better, maybe I can finally be free and move on, but that's what I think is haunting me. I don't know how to be alone. I was single for a year and a half before i met Andrew and he was such a ray of light in a dark, dark place. And as much as I want this to be a growth experience I can't help but feel like utter shit.

Why can't I just move on? From this place in between loving and hating you...Nowhere to belong..couldn't have said it better myself...
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/62271.html

This post will contain some bragging and a lot of happy dancing....

I GOT A JOB! And not just a job that I would settle for because there aren't any, but an amazing job that's going to be extremely awesome and challenging. I'm going to a be Technical Writer (my dream career at this point) at Sybase iAnwhere here in Waterloo. The people are amazing, the job is crazy and it doesn't help either that the pay is rather excellent. It was like a whirlwind...they interviewed me on Tuesday and offered me the job Tuesday night. Totally the oppisite of the shitty process I went through during the first round.

I'm SOOOO happy and relieved. I can focus on all my essays and assignments and final exams....Ugh..

YAY!!!!!!!
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/62128.html

Sometimes I wonder about Americans...I really do.

No offense to my American LJers...but wow..

American Announcer: What language are they speaking on the Russian bench Pierre?

Pierre McGuire: Russian

Duh. Sometimes I wonder how certain peole get the jobs they do.

Thank god I'll be back in my home and native land in 9 hours..
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/61465.html

Some of you know me well and not very well at all, but no matter where you fall I need an honest answer to this question.

WHAT WOULD YOU DO IF YOU KNEW THE ONLY WAY TO SURVIVE, TO FEEL OKAY WAS TO MOVE ON, BUT EVERY THING WITHIN YOU WAS KEEPING YOU IN THE SAME PLACE?
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/61245.html

Man...

My sadness with the Leafs pales in comparison to what Brian Burke must be going through, but I shall mention them anyway, starting with the worst first...

I can't believe his son is dead. i mean, I know i didn't know him or anything, but he was going to do so much good for the sports/world in general and then this happens. It just makes you wonder why, well me anyway.

Secondly, my beloved Matt Stajan has been traded. I knew it was coming, but this soon? Why now? Why ever? At least he got traded within canada and isn't THAT far, but *sigh*, watching hockey, or the Leafs for that matter just doesn't seem the same. Where's my number 14? Bah...at least I have Giguere to semi-love...*sigh*

And finally the time of my Leafs skate got changed and they're combining mine with 2 other times. Joy...Not a big deal, but bah, just adds insult to injury.
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/60983.html

So I'm sitting here updating as I'm waiting for the third period of the Leaf game to start and although we are not winning (of course), I'm happy to report that we are only losing 2-1. Against a team like Vancouver I'd say that's impressive, what is not impressive however is the fact that we got FIVE penalties in a row which led to Vancouver’s two goals....sigh. We were playing so well during the first half of the game too. Oh well, I'm expecting another loss.

 

Today is Andrew's birthday and we went out for dinner with his family last and it was awesome to see everyone again and strangely enough not awkward, That's probably because none of them know that we broke seven months ago and that could be because we don't act broken up at all. Not to mention we stayed up until 5 am playing Wii and watching Transformers 2 (which I loved by the way). Although I am not thrilled with our current situation and as pathetic as it sounds I'm willing to wait as long as it takes for him to be ready to marry me, within reason, and that in itself sounds ridiculous I know, but he's the love of my life, so what can I do?

 

School is awesome and settling down and I'm doing a lot better than I did in college which is strange. I've received two out of my three mid terms and I got 78% on my rhetoric exam and 82.5% on my brit lt exam (one of the highest marks in the class, hells yes). I have one more to get back, and unfortunately it's the one I fear the most. The prof is completely unreadable and it also doesn't help that he pretty much hates the class because we never participate, but that's because he shoots us down every time we do, so who knows. Wish me luck.

 

I ate Burger King today. That, my LJ friends, was a bad idea. My stomach has been effed ever since and I pretty much just feel like balls. The game is back on however so I shall update again soon:) Hope you're all well!
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/60580.html

So thanks to the wonderful Livejournal community I now have a BSB that wasn't on the album and it describes how I feel right now to a tee. And before I do my usual of posting the lyrics I thought I'd update everyone on my life.

I completed my first two university midterms on Wednesday and they were well...interesting....The first one seemed way too easy and the second one consisted over one quote and underneath that said discuss. I really have no clue how I did on either on them so we shall see I guess. My worst midterm is coming up on Tuesday and I am much scared.

The Leafs. I don't think there is enough angry words in the English language to express my feelings so I just won't. Being a Leaf fan is a sad exisistence these days...

In happy news my Three Days Grace tickets came on the mail today...YAYA!!!!!!! I'm so friggin excited!!:D

Anyway I think it's lyrics time:)

Wow,

This CD is amazing. It has so many different feels to it. I love it. I can sense some Nirvana influences and that just makes me so happy.

Now the next step: TOUR!!! They haven't announced any dates yet, but I'm so excited to let loose and mosh my life away:D

Sometimes I wonder about me and my music tastes. I mean a Jason Mraz concert made me appreciate life and I was all super happy and now thinking of a Three Days Grace concert, I can't wait to yell and scream about how much life can suck.

You guys really need to give this album a serious listen. It's called Life Starts Now.

I can't begin to tell you how friggin' excited I am for one very amazing reason: Between the days of Sept 22-Oct 9, three amazing artists come out with BRAND SPANKIN NEW CDS!!!!!!!!!!!! Three Days Grace, Michael Buble, BSB!!!!! SO HAPPY! And even though I've heard most of BSB's album having all the singles makes me EEEE!!!. It's so funny how all three songs are oppisites of each other, but I love them all equally. Right now I am relating heavily to Michael's single, but I'll have those lyrics at the end of this entry for your enjoyment:)

First things first, THE LEAFS. I actually got to watch the pregame tonight. Do I dare say that we might actually make the play offs this year? I just have one simple question and maybe somebody *cough cough** Stacey can help me out....Where the F did Jason Allison come from and why is he on our team??????? Agh! GO LEAFS GO!!! COME FASTER OCT 1.

God damn. I love this song so much and I have no idea why, there's just something about Akon's voice. My new roomate Pauline had me listening to it at first and man now I can't stop listening. My other two roomies are prolly really annoyed by now. Ah wells.

As some of you may or may not know I moved to Waterloo to attend what I am learning to be one of the greatest universities ever. I mean I guess I'm bias because it's the ONLY one I've ever been to, but they just make you feel so loved and part of something so much bigger than yourself it's amazing, I moved into my new place on Sept. 1 and it definitely took some adjusting to, but it'[s starting to feel more and more like home.the first week was a rough one, I was the only one here and I just missed home so much, but once Frosh started all was good.

Frosh was AMAZING. i met so many amazing people and learned so many crazy cheers I'm soooo happy I went to almost everything. And because of this Sean Kingston's song Fire burnin will never be the same to me again haha. I love you arts and especially my AP DRAGONS!!!!!

I'm not sure why but i decided to update to try and keep my mind off the fact that I feel like absoulute shit emotionally right now. I'm not sure what happened. I just feel like poop and writing always helps. I seem to be having deep and meaningful conversations with so many people these days. the thing I hate though is that the next day it seems like nothing happened or was accomplished. I don't know what I'm expecting to happen, but I feel such a strong connection and then nothing. I don't like it at all.

That aside I have so many wonderful things to look forward to:
  • NEW THREE DAYS GRACE ALBUM SEPTEMBER 22!
  • SO YOU THINK YOU CAN DANCE AT THE ACC SEPTEMBER 29
  • !!! THE LEAFS SEASON OPENER...HELLS TO THE YES OCTOBER 1
  • NEW BSB CD OCTOBER 6
EEEEEEEEE!

Must stay positive.  I am really super excited for classes to start and for me not to get lost when venturing off ring road please please pleaaaaase!

http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/57927.html

I just had to post to talk about the amazing time I had at Just For Laughs last night. OH MAN.

Zak and I really wanted to go because we love Mark Forward We saw him at the Ajax Yuk Yuks a few weeks ago, and then when we saw that it was him AND Jon Dore we just couldn't pass it up. We got there a few hours early so we decided to find somewhere to eat. After walking down Queen street (towards the Rivoli) and after Zak pointing out every sushi restaurant on the way there that I did not want to go to haha, we decided to just eat at the Rivoli.

The burger I had there was SO good. We still had like an hour and a half before the show so we thought we'd try to get in early. And we did, and we got to see the behind the scenes to the JOn Dore Show. It was so epic. It makes me so sad to think that show is cancelled. Replaced by Keys to the VIP....SERIOUSLY? Man...

To explain how funny the whole night was would be impossible. but all you need to know is that it was absoulutely amazing.

To top the night off we're on the bus on the way home and this 80 year old woman's phone rings and all you hear is..."you spin my head right round, right round when you go down, when you go down, down..." I could not stop laughing.

Anyway, I hope you all enjoyed this random update. I'm sorry I don't update more, I just don't have any motivation. I really do enjoy ready your entries though:)
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/57833.html

Ever since I was young your word is the word that always won.
Worry and wake the ones you love.
A phone call I'd rather not receive.
Please use my body while I sleep.
My lungs are fresh and yours to keep,
Kept clean and they will let you breathe.

Is this the way a toy feels when its batteries run dry?
I am the watch you always wear but you forget to wind.

Nobody plans to be half a world away at times like these,
so I sat alone and waited out the night.
The best part of what has happened was the part I must have missed.
So I'm asking you to shine it on and stick around.
I'm not writing my goodbyes.

I submit no excuse.
If this is what I have to do I owe you every day I wake.
If I could I would shrink myself and sink through your skin to your blood cells
and remove whatever makes you hurt but I am too weak to be your cure.

Is this the way a toy feels when its batteries run dry?
I am the watch you always wear but you forget to wind.

Nobody plans to be half a world away at times like these,
so I sat alone and waited out the night.
The best part of what has happened was the part I must have missed.
So I'm asking you to shine it on and stick around.
I'm not writing my goodbyes.

I'm not letting you check out.
You will beat this starting now and you will always be around.
I'm there to monitor your breathing
I will watch you while you're sleeping.
I will keep you safe and sound.
Does anybody remember back when you were very young.
Did you ever think that you would be this blessed?

Nobody plans to be half a world away at times like these,
so I sat alone and waited out the night.
The best part of what has happened was the part I must have missed.
So I'm asking you to shine it on and stick around.
I'm not writing my goodbyes.

Although I have already written my goodbyes, this song always reminds me of you and how I wish I could've saved you.

Instead, I will be honouring you forever.



I love you Uncle Joe.

I cannot wait to get out of here.

I can't stand inconsiderate people, who instead apologizing for their short comings, just make up constant excuses and LIE.

It's even worse when the things are so small and shouldn't mean a thingm but of course Ms. Dramatic has to make them huge and it just makes me so incredibly fucking angry that I sometimes wish you would just grow up and realize it's not all about you.

Jesus Christ I just don't get how some people can be so stupid.

Four more months....

God help me.

1. Open a music player.
2. Go to 'all music'/'library'.
3. Hit shuffle/repeat/randomise.
4. Find photos of the first 20 artists/bands that come up (no repeats and no cheating).
5. Have people guess who the artists/bands are.
6. Paste this in your journal and do it too, so I can have fun guessing as well.

So it looks as though I haven't updated in over a month and I figured if I'm stuck inside anyway, I might as well make an actual update.

My last few entries have certainly been somewhat vague/depressing, but that's because I didn't really know how to explain how I was feeling, and what I could understand, was random anyway. To make an extremely long and complicated story short Andrew and I broke up for about a months time. It was hard to say we were broken up though when absolutely nothing between us had changed except for our title.  This is was obviously not getting us anywhere so I confronted him about it and decided to start moving on as best I could. During this time I learned a lot about myself and gained a lot of strength. The thought of losing me forever, however, terrified Andrew and we are now back together. I know it's the right thing. I love him more than anything and I think we're both happier than we've ever been, so yay! So much for a short story eh?

In other news, I still don't have a steady job and I'm feeling the effects of it. Living on a very tight budget is definitely interesting. I'm almost out of debt though and I can see the light at the end of the tunnel.

The Leafs. Oh the Leafs. I didn't think it was possible, but Vesa Toskala actually aggravates me more than Andrew Raycroft did. He does not seem to understand the concept of guarding the entire net. Bah. And it also helps a goalie when he has you know, DEFENCE! Man, I can hardly watch the games anymore because they pain me so. I'm going to the Leafs  Skate on feb. 16 and if Vesas on my skate, god help him. Other than the Staj meister I have no problem viocing my opinios to the players haha.

Between the combination of mass amounts of snow and strep throat I've barely been able to leave the condo and it sucks. Then again, I don't where I'd go, but hey, just having the option would be great. Oh the joys of living in Canada, not that I'd live anywhere else. Woo juniors!:D So on my day of staying in I've decided to listen to BSB, man I love them. Their new album is set for 2010 and holy shiz I'm so excited. It'll also be interesting to see what Nick's new solo CD is going to sound like compared to Now or Never as it was pretty much crap haha.

But I just realized this entry has been one big rambling so when I have more intersting things to talk about I shall post!

Ahh! I'm going to be 22 innn....19 days! AHHHHHHHHH!

...looking back on things I was trying to be someone, I played my part
and kept you in the dark
now let me show you the shape of my heart<3

Brian showing me his heart:)

So if you're a close friend of mine you would know this about me, and if you're not, well you're about to find out.

I am an avid Backstreet Boy fan, and even though I constantly get made fun of because of this I don't care. Ever since that first day I saw them when I was 12 I made some sort of connection with them and that connection has lasted until this very day and probably for the rest of my life. I know they're silly boy band who maybe write a fifth of their songs, but they are talented, they can sing and play instruments and with the "musicians" that are around these days that's saying a lot. They are also just generally amazing people. I first met nick in 2001 when I went to see him at Much Music. I had no intention of even getting in the building, but his security guard got my front row centre and Nick even spent 5 minutes with me to talk and that was one of the happiest days of my life. When I met the rest of the boys (minus A.J) in..maybe 2004? They all took the time to talk with me and even though they probably hear the same stories and meet thousands of fans every day, they still made me feel special and appreciated. I know from meeting other celebrities that there is no way I would be given the same courtesy. I know this is like an insane rant but I just had to get it out. I'm going to see them in concert in two days and I can't even put into words how excited I am. So say what you will, but I truly respect them as people and musicians and if you don't like it well read another journal!

Well hello there all!!

Andy pointed out to me that it has indeed been a LONG time since I've updated. Of course a lot has been going on in my life, but I'll just highlight the main points.

I graduated. Holy shit. I don't know if I'm ready to not be a student anymore. I guess it all has to do with moving on with life and becoming an adult, but I'm fighting it. I've applied to about12 or so jobs and have only had one interview with no result, but I don't really feel discouraged because I know this is going to be a slow process and when the right opportunity comes, I'll know it. I'm also going to really miss Humber and all the people in it. My teachers and classmates really taught me a lot and after all my doubts on whether or not I chose the right program, I know I did.

The Leafs. Oh boy, so much has been changing and for some reason I just can't get motivated to care. I mean if Stajan gets traded I will wage war on MLSE, but other than that I see it as a positive thing that so many players are leaving. I'll miss Tucker, but him and his crew (especially Raycrap) need to go. Although the worst of all the seeds in my opinion is still on the team. McCabe. Why not buy him out and take his money and give it to someone who is actually useful. Just a thought. As far as Ron Wilson goes I have mixed feelings. I honestly don't know THAT much about him. I just read Damien Cox's article about him, and how he is not exactly "media friendly", which kind of pisses me off because it could be me interviewing him one day and if he's a prick to me, he better watch out!

Andrew and I are doing well considering all the stuff that's going on in his life right now. I'm not going to get into obviously because it's very personal, but I  think it just shows us how strong our relationship is. There are times when it seemed like it was unbearable, but I'm still here and so is he and I still love him with all I am, so we must be doing something right!<3
http://heart-whispers.livejournal.com/52622.html

So I haven' posted in what? 4months? Yeah well nobody told me that I would have absoulutely NO free time during my final year in Humber'sjournalism program. At times it's frustrating when all I want to do is relax for a few days, but for the most part it makes me feel as though I've truly accomplished something. I'm the news editor of the HUmber Et Cetera from Mon-Wed and I work at Toronto Community News on Thurs and Fri.

It's a strange power trip being on charge of reporters and then on Thurs and Fridays going back to being at the bottom of the journalism totem pole. I write briefs and the occasional stories. 3 of which I've gotten published. It's a pretty damn good feeling.

I also won the Toronto Star Award for best overall contribution to the Humber Et Cetera. BOO YEAH!

There were two main reasons I wanted to update though

1. The new BSB CD is AMAZING. I'm not just saying that because I've been a fan for 11 years, it really is amazing.  I love their new sound and although Kevin will be missed they do just fine without me. The songs are all pretty depressing though, no Backstreet's Back-esque songs. Something tells me either Nick or Howie got the hearts brokeded...:*(

2. The Leafs.....*sigh*.....I didn't think it could get worse, but it has. I hate them, and I hate the fact that despite hating them I still love them dearly. Two things need to happen: Maurice, fired. Fergueson, Fired. So siimple.

MICHAEL BUBLE ON MY BIRTHDAY!!! I love you Andrew Blakey!

I'm in a very music-y mood, and when I'm in this mood I feel the need to write. I'm just in one of those moods where I can go from Eminem to Jason Mraz and I love it. Just dancing and singing and enjoying all types of music without being my usual picky self. In the words of Mr. Mraz "Are you prepared to take a dive into the deep end of my head?" I've also taken interest in improving my Spanish, and of course, Josh Groban has come to the rescue, Even though he sings in Italian (I think), they're so insanely similar that it still has the same effect.

It's been what almost 4 months since I updated? There has definately been a lot going on ans to spare anyone who actually reads this the agony, I'll give you the condensed version hehe.

I moved back home in April and survived Semester 4 with flying colours. Coming home was a bit rocky at the beginning, but I'm settled in now and quite happy to be home. Didn't really do much until mid May really. Andrew and I celebrated our one year anniversary on the 19th. We celebrated with the usaual Meggie and Andrewness and I honestly fell deeper in love with him. I just feel as though we've reached a point in our relationship of higher understanding that most people don't reach in a lifetime and regardless of what life throws at me I'll always have us and that's such an amazing feeling. You're stuck with me my love:P

It was also around this time that I started training for my job at Beck Taxi. I did a lot better than I thought I would., but after about 10 shifts or so, along with medical issues I felt as though the job wasnt for me. This Sunday was supposed to be my last day, but I was diagnosed with Pink eye today so yeah, no more work for me:P

That's  another thing. I seem to be getting a string of infections lately. Nothing too earth shattering, but enough to be a nuicense I'll say that much. Let's hope that this Pink Eye is the nail in my infectious coffin.

I'm probab;y going to be spending the rest of the summer relaxing and spending time with the man I love and that makes me incredibly happy. My internship is also pretty much a go for September which is amazing.

It just as feels as though, despite all the bumps along the way, my life, in every aspect, is finally heading where it should be.

Oh and where would this update be without hockey??
